intro: Astragalus alpinus f. albinus, commonly known as the alpine milkvetch, is a rare and striking plant characterized by its white or pale yellow flowers. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is native to high-altitude regions of the Alps and other mountainous areas. The plant features small, compound leaves and produces pods that contain small, round seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in many regions.
